definition: public/collectively owned/common/international (e.g. high seas, metric system, calendar)/make public/fair/just/Duke, highest of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/honorable (gentlemen)/father-in-law/male (animal)
to adequately take into account both public and private interests

sentences.english: And joint state-private ownership was one way led to the goal.
sentences.chinese: “公私合營”即是達成這個任務的一種手段。

sentences.english: Our creed has always been that business is business.
sentences.chinese: 我們的信條一直是公私分明。

sentences.english: The defacement or destruction of public or private property.
sentences.chinese: 損壞或破壞公私財產的行爲。

sentences.english: After the founding in 1953, Donglai bank into public-private partnership, Qingdao Branch.
sentences.chinese: 建國後1953年，東萊銀行併入公私合營青島分行。

sentences.english: This will break scripts dependant on the private-public key pair.
sentences.chinese: 這會破壞依賴於公私密鑰對的腳本。

sentences.english: Public-private partnership generally refers to the joint efforts by public and private sectors to handle administrative affairs.
sentences.chinese: 公私協力泛指公部門與私部門共同處理事務之情形。

sentences.english: It is a state-run enterprise set up in 1956.
sentences.chinese: 陽市醬油廠是1956年公私合營時組建的國營企業。

sentences.english: In a joint state-private enterprise, the private owner is more active as an operator.
sentences.chinese: 公私合營企業中，私方作爲企業的操作者更具主動性。

sentences.english: In 1954 our firm became a joint state-privately operated one.
sentences.chinese: 1954年，我們公司改爲公私合營了。

sentences.english: In modern society, the mergence of the public law and civil law gives rise to a brand-new social law.
sentences.chinese: 現代社會，公私法的融合造成全新的社會法。

sentences.english: Initiatives must forge partnerships between the public and private sectors.
sentences.chinese: 項目必須促成公私部門之間的合作伙伴關係。

sentences.english: The United Nations Environment Program (UNEP) and Yale University sponsor the public-private consortium initiative.
sentences.chinese: 聯合國環保署與美國耶魯大學積極資助該公私機構。

sentences.english: Confucianism and Legalism outlook on public and private interests had a two-fold historic influence.
sentences.chinese: 儒法崇公抑私的公私觀的歷史影響具有兩重性。

sentences.english: The PPIP program specifically allows for foreign sources of investment.
sentences.chinese: 公私合營投資計劃尤其爲海外投資者打開了大門。

sentences.english: Public-private coexist two-appulse-one compound system created?
sentences.chinese: 公私並存二合一混合製造成了什麼呢？

sentences.english: The streetscape was one of Chicago's first public-private partnerships.
sentences.chinese: 該街景項目是芝加哥最早的公私合作項目之一。

definition: to commandeer/to take over for the state
to gain from corrupt dealing/to engage in graft/to feather one's nest
variant of 資財|资财[zi1 cai2]
canvass for contributions/to recruit/to collect/to raise
to leave impulsively/to send out (merchandise) without authorization
